snippet: The N.H.L. on Wednesday continued to move toward its third lockout in 17 years, with both the league and the hockey players’ union offering new proposals that the other called insignificant.
abstract: More than 250 NHL players convene in Manhattan for a briefing on contract negotiations and their options in the event of a lockout; one option includes playing overseas, which close to 400 players did during the last lockout, in 2004-2005.
lead_paragraph: The N.H.L. on Wednesday continued to move toward its third lockout in 17 years, with both the league and the hockey players’ union offering new proposals that the other called insignificant.

headline.seo: N.H.L. Labor Talks: Offers Exchanged but Neither Are Embraced
headline.main: Offers Rejected as Players Ponder Europe as Option
headline.print_headline: Offers Rejected as Players Ponder Europe as Option
